summary: The document is a confidential memorandum from Joseph P. Mirabile of the Operations Support Branch, dated 13 October 1978. It details the death of Adrian Fisher Sherman, Jr., on 23 September 1978, from a heart attack, and outlines the security concerns arising from his death. Sherman, who had a history with the Agency and was of interest to the DCD and FRD, was found with a missing document related to a plan to assassinate Fidel Castro, among other personal items. His son was cooperative and understood the need for discretion. The Foreign Resources Division briefed the DCI on the case, concluding no further action was necessary at the time, except for monitoring the case for 60-90 days.
